answers.answer: Hello.It is possible that the previous episodes may have been a seizure not picked up in EEG. The symptoms are a bit unusual.The stiffening of the body does hint strongly towards a seizure. Let us wait for this EEG report. I guess you will need some anti seizure medication.Regards

question: I have suffered two bouts of a seizure/black-out type occurance in the last year and a half.  Both times I had severe flu and/or pnemonia symptoms.  A fever was present both times.A couple days ago while suffering from flu symptoms with high fever, I awoke to find that I was going to pass out.  I told my fiance, who again watched as I slipped into unconsciousness.  She reports that I lie rigid with my eyes open.  On the earlier occasion she said I stopped breathing for a short time.  I have a visual and auditory warning of the impending "black-out".  It begins to darken from the sides and my ears ring louder and louder until it's all quiet.  This is quite frightening.  I remember being very hot this last time preceeding the black-out.  So after waking i consumed some fluids, as best as I could, to relieve any dehydration (which was my diagnosis for the first occurances in 2006) and tried to relax.  An hour later I awoke and blacked-out again, this time with vomiting while unconscious.In 2006 I had a sleep derived EEG and CT scan of the head with normal results.  I have had full blood tests including diabetes testing.  Today I had an EEG again.  My blood tests are not in as of yet.I am looking for input on this.
title: Seizure or no seizure?
